channel.title: Latest PHMSA Hazardous Materials Incident Reports, for CA
channel.description: The latest Form 5800.1 hazardous material reports submitted to the Department of Transportation and posted online by the Pipeline and Hazardous Materials Safety Administration, for CA

item.title: Report E-2023100089
item.description:
Report E-2023100089

Identified by scraper @ 2023-10-05T15:12:02+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-10-03
  • City: BLYTHE
  • State: CA
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: XPO LOGISTICS, LLC
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: XPO Logistics terminal UBY experienced a UN2810 Allyl Hexanoate release from a 30-gallon metal drum. ERTS dispatched contractors to conduct containment and cleanup. Contractors arrived onsite and confirmed approximately 5-gallons of product released to a 5’ x 2’ area of the dock floor due to a forklift puncture. Absorbents were deployed and worked into the impacted area. The damaged drum, impacted absorbents, and PPE were then collected and containerized into a 55-gallon metal drum. The waste was staged onsite for terminal personnel to manage.

  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0

  • Description: During off loading the warehouse crew accidentally put a forklift fork into one case of dominator (un1814) damaging 2 of the inner poly 2.5 gallon jugs and releasing 0.5 gallons of product. Contractors were dispatched for the containment and cleanup of the release.

item.description:
Report E-2023100153

Identified by scraper @ 2023-10-11T15:10:53+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-09-04
  • City: BLYTHE
  • State: CA
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident

  • Carrier/Reporter: XPO LOGISTICS FREIGHT, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: During off loading it was discovered that the load had shifted during transit due to improper blocking and bracing and that one of the metal 3 gallon cans of adhesive(un1133) had fallen and had released 5 ounces of product. The warehouse crew was able to contain and cleanup the release, so no contractors were dispatched.

item.title: Report X-2023090646
item.description:
Report X-2023090646

Identified by scraper @ 2023-10-11T15:10:53+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-09-12
  • City: CHINO
  • State: CA
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: Package Handler noticed Haz package was wet and informed Management right away. Management placed leaky package inside a tote with absorbent. QA was then called to come collect the Haz package to process. DescribePack: The top cap of the bottle broke off and leaked out. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: Package was placed inside a tote with absorbent to prevent leak from spreading. Package and cleanup absorbent was then placed inside a hazmat bag with absorbent. Bag was then placed inside a hazmat tote.

item.title: Report X-2023090630
item.description:
Report X-2023090630

Identified by scraper @ 2023-10-11T15:10:53+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-09-09
  • City: CHINO
  • State: CA
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: Package Handler noticed package was wet and leaking, and informed Management right away. Manager used abosrbent to stop leak from spreading and informed QA-admin. QA-Admin came and placed leaky hazmat and cleanup material into a hazmat bag with absorbent, and placed bag inside a hazmat tote. DescribePack: The plastic bag inner packaging got a hole on the top and caused package to leak. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: Absorbent was used to stop the leak from spreading, and used to clean up the spill. Package and cleanup material was then placed inside a hazmat bag with absorbent, and the bag was placed inside a hazmat tote.

item.title: Report X-2023090174
item.description:
Report X-2023090174

Identified by scraper @ 2023-10-11T15:10:53+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-09-08
  • City: SANTA FE SPRINGS
  • State: CA
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Rail
  • Carrier/Reporter: Union Pacific Railroad
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: TILX 160815 was reported to be leaking from the Bottom Outlet Valve (BOV). An estimated 2 ounces of product leaked from the BOV nozzle threads and cap. The cap was less then tool tight, adding Teflon tape to the threads and tightening the cap stopped the release. The BOV was in the closed position. Product in the nozzle was residue from off-loading operations. The shipper's facility is next the location of release. The shipper will route the car back to their facility and preform an additional inspection.

item.title: Report E-2023100088
item.description:
Report E-2023100088

Identified by scraper @ 2023-10-05T15:12:02+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-09-21
  • City: FRESNO
  • State: CA
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: R&L CARRIERS SHARED SERVICES, L.L.C.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: On September 21, 2023, four (4) 5-gallon pails of paint were crushed and released approximately six (6) gallons of product to the pallet. R+L Carriers retained Cura Emergency Services, LC who dispatched a crew from Ten-West Environmental (10W) to remediate the impacted site. The crew identified the impacted cargo and secured the damaged pails in one (1) 55-gallon poly drum. The crew utilized absorbents to collect the released material. All impacted solids were contained in a separate 55-gallon drum. Both drums were labeled and staged onsite to be profiled and disposed of by R+L personnel.

item.description:

Identified by scraper @ 2023-10-04T18:16:05+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-09-04
  • City: SACRAMENTO
  • State: CA
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident

  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0

  • Description: SequenceEvent: UNDECLARED HAZMAT SMARTPOST PACKAGE CAME FROM THE OVERHEAD SORTER WET AND TORN OPEN. LQ MARKING OBSCURED BY SHIPPING LABEL. SMARTPOST TRACKING NUMBER IS OLD, TRK 9261290983497800001299 IS ALREADY DELIVERED BUT IS NOW LINKED ON SAME SHIPPING LABEL AS THIS PACKAGE. PACKAGE DAMAGED DURING OVERHEAD SORTATION, TOO MUCH RECIRCULATION. DescribePack: ONE BOTTLE EMPTY WITH LOOSE SPRAYHEAD. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: SPILL COLLECTED WITH ABSORBENT MATERIALS. PACKAGE PLACED IN HAZMAT BAG LINED DRUM.

item.title: Report X-2023090512
item.description:
Report X-2023090512

  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: Box was found wet from the top flaps. Absorbent was used to clean up the leakage. The package was then placed in a hazardous waste bag and then into a red hazardous bin. DescribePack: The top and side flaps were found wet from the outer and inner parts of the box. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: The package was picked up with double layered gloves. It was then but in a red hazardous bin that was layered with 2 sheets of absorbent, a clear hazardous waste bag, and then another 2 sheets of absorbent.

item.title: Report I-2023090145
item.description:
Report I-2023090145

Identified by scraper @ 2023-10-11T15:10:53+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-08-31
  • City: La Habra
  • State: CA
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: UNITED PARCEL SERVICE
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: UPS DRIVER PICKED UP PACKAGE FROM CUSTOMER LOCATION, AS DRIVER WAS COMING DOWN EAST PARKWOOD AVE TO MAKE HIS NEXT DELIVERY, HE BEGAN TO SMELL SOMETHING BURNING SO HE PULLED OVER. DRIVER OPENED THE BULKHEAD DOOR AND SAW BACK OF HIS CR FULL SMOKE SO HE JUMPED OUT. LEFT THE BULKHEAD DOOR OPEN AND CALLED THE SUPERVISOR TO NOTIFY HIM OF THE INCIDENT. SUPERVISOR FOLLOWED CHAIN OF COMMAND. MANAGER CALLED 911. OUTSIDE RESPONDER WAS CONTACTED. 1500 THE FIRE DEPARTMENT ARRIVED SHORTLY AFTER AND REMOVE SMOKING PACKAGE FROM PACKAGE CAR. AT THIS TIME, THEY BEGAN TO DO EMERGENCY MITIGATION BY SPRAYING WATER ONTO THE PACKAGE TO BRING DOWN THE TEMPERATURE AROUND 15:30, AT 17:50 THE OUTSIDE RESPONDER "PATRIOT ENVIRONMENTAL" ARRIVED ON THE SCENE AND THE FIRE DEPARTMENT STOP PUTTING WATER ON THE PACKAGE. THEY PUT SAND ON THE CONTENTS OF THE PACKAGE AND BEGAN BREAKING THE CONTENTS TO REMOVE THE BATTERIES.FROM THIS POINT THEY MONITORED THE TEMPERATURES OF THE PACKAGE TO ENSURE THEY WERE DROPPING. TEMPERATURE WAS STILL UNSTABLE FOR THE NEXT COUPLE OF HOURS. AROUND 20:00 THE TEMPERATURE OF THE PACKAGE WAS STABLE ENOUGH AND THEY WERE GOING TO START THE PROCESS OF CLEANING UP AND PROCESSING THE CONTENTS OF THE SPILL .OUTSIDE RESPONDER TOOK ALL CONTENTS.

  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: On American Airlines Flight 2468 the customer reported to the Flight Attendants that his 6 month old iPad Pro was becoming very hot and he was worried it would evolve into a thermal runaway. Flight Attendants and customer tried to cool the device but to no avail. Flight Attendants placed the iPad in the fire containment bag with 5 Iiters of water. Event consumed 45 minutes of flight time before iPad was deemed cooled.
